author: Moanwar
body:
We have optimized the PID ONNX models used in the clu3d and linking steps of TICLv5, as they were consuming a large amount of time during inference. The main optimization we applied was enabling ONNX Runtime graph optimizations, which automatically fuse operations such as Conv + LeakyReLU. This provided the largest speed improvement.
We also removed unnecessary transpose operations, so the model now expects the input data directly in the correct format.
The physics performance should remain exactly the same, no differences are expected. The model should simply run faster.
This still needs to be tested within the current PR that makes TICLv5 the default : https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/49932

FYI @felicepantaleo
title: Optimize pid onnx model for linking and clu3d
